In his essay <cite>The Exchanging Disk Dream</cite>, Jason Scott lays out his dream for a virtual computer lab on the web, using JavaScript emulation technology.

This page demonstrates how the JMESS and PCE emulators, along with my RetroWeb Browser framework, can implement this vision&mdash;today!

* The PCE-based emulators support insertion of one or more floppy disks once running, but currently my interface limits this to the first floppy disk drive.
* Saving disks from PCE seems to only result in a blank disk being saved.
* JSMESS saves disks okay, but does not support changing disks after boot.
